description:
Acerca del empleo
* IMPRESCINDIBLE ADJUNTAR CV

¿Te imaginas una financiera transparente, que fuera responsable y explicara perfectamente sus productos, sin dejar lugar a dudas? Sería genial, ¿verdad? Pues así es Sofinco, la nueva financiera responsable y transparente.

Sofinco es la entidad en España que pertenece al Grupo Crédit Agricole Consumer Finance, líder europeo en crédito al consumo y nuestros valores son la base de cómo hacemos las cosas: Innovación, Espíritu de Equipo, Cercanía y Compromiso. ¡Por ello y por mucho más hemos sido certificados por Great Place to Work en 22!

Main activities and tasks:
Learn about our datalake loading process, using Linux, Vertica, Oracle databases and Talend ETL (extraction/Transformacion/load tool)
Check consistency data
Work with other team members to raise/solve data quality issues
Work with other departments to support their reporting
Fulfill data requests made by other teams

Requirements:
Imprescindible poder firmar convenio de prácticas con centro de estudios.
Quantitative degree (computer science, engeneering, pyshics, maths)
Knowledge of ddbb and SQL
Fluent in English
Interest on the consumer finance industry
SQL
Linux

Skills profile:
Analytic and scientific mindset
Likes to communicate results and tell data stories to technical and not technical audience
Enjoys working in international teams

¿Qué te ofrecemos?
Beca remunerada.
Formarás parte de un equipo puntero de análisis de negocio y gestión de proyectos, con relación con las diferentes áreas de negocio de la empresa.
Aprenderás sobre el mundo empresarial y experimentarás formar parte de un grupo financiero con más de 70 años de experiencia.
Aprenderás de procesos y metodologías para la gestión de proyectos.
Aprenderás términos y KPIs del Sector Financiero.


Sofinco es una empresa comprometida con la igualdad, la diversidad y la integración a todos los niveles. El proceso de selección de Sofinco se basa en la igualdad, evaluando cada candidatura con criterios objetivos basados en la experiencia, formación, habilidades y competencias, sin que medie ninguna discriminación por razón de sexo, edad, raza, etc.

*IMPRESCINDIBLE ADJUNTAR CV*

Acerca del empleo
From ASTEK Iberia, we are looking for a Data Analyst to work with our partner leader in B2B IT Travel.

You would be contributing to the 'Performance Measurement & Reporting'' area of Internal IT.

Responsibilities
Assist the Internal IT organisation in setting performance objectives and translating them into measurable metrics.
Leading the collection and documentation 'Performance Measurement & Reporting' requirements from the Internal IT organisation; Assess their feasibility
Assess, choose, and/or develop a solution to meet the collected requirements.
Leading the Implementation, documentation, and maintaining a 'Performance Measurement & Reporting' infrastructure (e.g., Qlik Stream/Qlik apps, PowerBI, ServiceNow)


Qualifications
Excellent Analytical Skills, Organization Skills, Problem Determination and Resolution Processes
Excellent Oral and Written Communications in English language
Work in an English spoken environment and with distributed and multicultural teams
Excellent Interpersonal skills; team player
University degree in Scientific (Computer Sciences, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics or similar) studies.
Experience in Qlik or PowerBI. Notions of ServiceNow operational reporting and performance analytics, a plus.

Literate in Business Intelligence, notions of Requirement Management, Customer Focus, Flexibility, Functional specification writing, testing, Analytical thinking, Communication, Aptitude to write/code algorithms; aptitude to model, extract, transfer and load data.
Ideally, some notion of IT Service Management principles.

If you are interested and want more information about the position, please contact to abernard@astek.es, enclosing a CV detailed in english

Acerca del empleo
¿Quiénes somos?
Somos una consultora especializada en economía, finanzas y tecnología. Trabajamos con grandes entidades financieras y bancos de España y Latinoamérica, así como con grandes empresas nacionales e internacionales. Contamos con un reconocimiento elevado en el mercado español. Nuestro modelo de consultoría se basa en el rigor técnico, combinado con una fuerte orientación al cliente, al servicio y a la innovación. Afi cuenta además con la Escuela de Finanzas, una escuela de negocios especializada que dispone de una amplia oferta de programas para profesionales

Perfil del candidato ideal para el puesto:
Graduado en ingeniería informática u otras ingenierías con base fuerte en programación (telecomunicaciones, doble grado matemáticas/informática, etc.) o graduados en matemáticas, estadística. En cualquier caso, el candidato debe ser un apasionado de los datos.
¿Qué buscamos en el candidato?
Alguien con al menos 5 años de experiencia laboral en análisis y ciencia de datos.
Amplio conocimiento en el uso de las técnicas de creación de modelos predictivos estadísticos y/omachine learning.
Destrezas de programación en R y paquetes típicos (tidyverse, dplyr, data.table)
Destrezas de programación en Python y paquetes típicos (NumPy, pandas y scikit-learn)
Capacidades de visualización avanzada de datos usando las librerías habituales tanto en R (ggplot2) como en Python (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Bokeh, Plotly).
Implementación de cuadros de mando mediante shiny y/o Dash.
Control del ciclo de vida del software mediante Git.
Ser capaz de transmitir resultados de manera simple a las áreas de negocio, generando entregables.
Experiencia en tareas de preparación, limpieza y manipulación de datos provenientes de fuentes diversas.
Conocimientos de bases de datos relacionales SQL.
Experiencia trabajando con información proveniente de APIs o Web Scraping.
Automatización y optimización de procesos de negocio.
Atención por los detalles.
Experiencia trabajando en equipos multidisciplinares.
Nivel de inglés avanzado.
¿Qué otros conocimientos habilidades se valorarán positivamente?
Formación de postgrado o máster en el área de la ciencia/análisis de datos.
Conocimientos de bases de datos NoSQL como MongoDB y/o BigQuery.
Conocimientos de librería deep learning (Keras/TensorFlow).
Conocimiento de PLN (NLTK).
Herramientas dereporting orientas a Business Intelligence (Power BI, Tableau, etc.)
Conocimientos de plataformas decloud computing (AWS, Azure o Google Cloud).
Tecnologías de computación distribuida (Spark).
Experiencia trabajando con metodologías Agile (SCRUM, Kanban)
Experiencia en proyectos de ámbitos económicos y financieros.
¿Qué ofrecemos al candidato?
Equipo de trabajo dinámico y joven, con pasión por su trabajo.
Trabajar en un ambiente con altas capacidades.
Programa de desarrollo y formación profesional (clases de inglés, oratoria, etc.).
Tickets restaurante, transporte, cheques guardería, seguro médico.
Jueves deafterwork.
Modelo híbrido de teletrabajo y trabajo en la oficina.
Retribución en base a las capacidades del candidato.

Acerca del empleo
Hej! We’re expanding our Digital Hub and I’m looking for engineers to join our new Digital Food Experience area.

Our teams are growing and looking for new engineers looking into new challenges to create a better everyday life for the many people where Food is an integral part of how we can achieve that goal.

At IKEA, you’re welcome no matter where you come from, what you believe, and what you look like. We don’t even care how you have furnished your home. We’re interested in you simply because you’re you. Our different views, backgrounds, and personalities make us better understand our customers, give us more fun at work and spark more and better ideas. Perhaps your unique take on something could lead to a great idea that creates a better everyday life for the many people.


IKEA FOOD

In-store restaurants, coffee-corners, bistros or Swedish markets are part of the Ikea food journey driving the food services to one of the most recognized Ikea experiences engaging thousands of customers around the world.

We have the challenge to empower and innovate the digital experience for the many people - internal and external users – making their everyday life better thanks to technology. Among others, you will work on software solutions to:

- Create new online experiences
- Boost the in-store journey
- Improve logistic efficiency
- Have efficient food services operations
- Reduce waste, contributing to a sustainable planet

We have a wide focus in more than 400 stores. Our environment is completely international where English is the main language having digital hubs spread across the world. You will have colleagues in many cities like Amsterdam, Malmö or Philadelphia.


OUR LANDSCAPE

We don’t have a closed technical stack because we like to favour the use of the most modern tools and languages when picking the most appropriate tool for the job. Currently we are primarily using:

- Cloud infrastructure (mainly GCP), handled with Terraform to remain provider agnostic.
- TypeScript, Java, Python, Golang.
- React, Vue.js

We adapt our stack to the best suitable solution. All our developments focus on high quality standards. We love to follow principles like CI/CD, monitoring and testing automation. Also, we love to apply trending approaches like event driven systems, API firsts, or hexagonal architecture.

We believe in cross-functional devops teams so your team and yourself as a team member will be responsible for of all technical aspects of the products during its lifetime; including design, development, deployment, evolution and maintenance.


ABOUT YOU

As a hands-on Software Engineer, you will consistently have opportunities to work closely with other Software Engineers as part of an agile team. We expect you to:

• Have a strong technical background that allows you to contribute shaping the technical direction of your team, while consistently delivering production-ready code.
• Know how to balance technical best practices and pragmatism.
• Be able to design, deliver and maintain working software.
• Have an agile mindset focusing on the end-user in an iteratively and incremental manner.
• Be proactive and responsible of your team solutions.


ABOUT THIS WORK AREA

Food Digital is a relatively new area, with most still to be done. You’ll be joining a product squad to work in an agile environment. While part of a huge ecosystem, in Food Digital we own our solutions. That means that the team is responsible for the whole journey of the product; from design, picking the most suitable technology, to implementing an appropriate observability system. You’ll be working closely with product as one team, and be part of an amazing community of engineers that all share a quality driven mentality. You will also have ownership over your career plan, deciding in which direction you want to grow. Your manager will support and advice in your journey, and all engineers have access to any learning platform necessary (like Pluralsight).

The IKEA culture and values are very much a part of our business and day to day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it’s important for us that you share our values! You can read more regarding those and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com or just watch this movie: https://vimeo.com/290339889.
Most things remain to be done. And that’s why we want you to help us.

Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they’re 100% “qualified”. If this is part of the reason you hesitate to apply, we like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think. We look forward to receiving your application. (From: “Why Women Don’t Apply for Jobs Unless They’re 100% Qualified” by Tara Sophia Mohr, August 2014”)

Acerca del empleo
Veeva is a mission-driven organization that aspires to help our customers in Life Sciences and Regulated industries bring their products to market, faster. We are shaped by our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our teams develop transformative cloud software, services, consulting, and data to make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. Veeva is a work anywhere company. You can work at home, at a customer site, or in an office on any given day. As a Public Benefit Corporation , you will also work for a company focused on making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.

The Role

Veeva Link seeks a mid to senior Python Data Engineer that will participate in all aspects of architecting and developing new and innovative data pipelines and data handling. You will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology and new product development in an established company that is rapidly growing. This is a great opportunity for an engineer looking to expand their well-established career, who is excited about search, solving complex problems, ownership, and who enjoys working with technologies like Python, ElasticSearch, and AWS.

You must be based in Spain and be eligible for employment within the EU, as Veeva does not sponsor employment visa processes for this role.

What You'll Do

Participate in architecting and extending our data pipelines to accommodate the rising data amounts
Collect data e.g., publications from doctors, meant for our production systems from several internal sources into a stable data set
Make the data consumable for other teams using the right databases (e.g., ElasticSearch or Postgres) and APIs

Requirements

5+ years of working as a software or data engineer
Very good Python knowledge with one widely used framework like Django, FastAPI, or Flask
Very good knowledge of one widely used RDS like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MSSQL, or Oracle
Good ElasticSearch and Git knowledge
Excellent verbal and written communication in English

Nice to Have

Knowledge in data streaming, AWS, REST APIs and GraphQL

#RemoteSpain Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world. Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams.

Acerca del empleo
Job Description

Buscamos gente como tú: ¡Que disfrutas de tu trabajo, aceptas retos para llegar más lejos en tu carrera, te sientes orgulloso de pertenecer a una compañía Top Employer, te gusta el trabajo en equipo y colaborar con tu experiencia para que todos seamos mejores en nuestro día a día!

¿Quieres recibir formación en últimas tecnologías y tener la posibilidad de certificarte de manera gratuita?

¿Quieres trabajar en un ambiente dinámico, con proyectos de gran envergadura aplicando tecnología de última generación y trabajar en equipo con profesionales de primer nivel?

Buscamos en cualquier localización a varios Consultores Power BI , apasionados por los datos en todas sus formas y procesos. Extracción, transformación, procesamiento y visualización.

Imprescindible

Experto en PowerBI, tanto en las áreas de visualización, como especialmente, modelado
Conocimiento de las herramientas complementarias a PowerBI (DAX Studio, Tabular Editor,)
Optimización de rendimiento en PowerBI
Utilización de Data Warehouses y modelización usando metodologías Kimball/Inmon
Experiencia en entornos empresariales complejos y con grandes volumetrías de datos
Trabajo en equipo usando frameworks agile
Interlocución con áreas de negocio
Comunicación en inglés
Proactividad y ganas de aportar.

Deseable

Experiencia usando PowerBI en escenarios de tiempo real/streaming
Conocimiento de otras herramientas de la Power Platform (PowerAutomate, PowerApps)
Experiencia en plataformas de Datos cloud (Snowflake, Azure Synapse,..)

¿Qué beneficios ofrecemos en Avanade?

Horario que te permitirá conciliar vida laboral y personal.
Participación en proyectos importantes para clientes de primer nivel nacional e internacional.
Una atractiva remuneración compuesta por un salario bruto anual y un programa de beneficios corporativos y retribución flexible.

Puedes revisar la lista completa de beneficios en el siguiente enlace: benefits-spain.pdf (avanade.com)

¿Estás interesado? ¡Inscríbete ahora!

Te esperamos ¡Avanade es tu compañía!

About Avanade

Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.

We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.

We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping young people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.

Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

Acerca del empleo
About us
RavenPack is the leading big data analytics provider for financial services. Financial professionals rely on RavenPack for its speed and accuracy in analyzing large amounts of unstructured content. RavenPack’s products allow clients to enhance returns, reduce risk and increase efficiency by systematically incorporating the effects of public information in their models or workflows. Our clients include the most successful hedge funds, banks, and asset managers in the world. We're privately funded and VC backed, and our recent Series B round raised $10 million.
Ravenpack has 15TB of textual data available in an archive stretching back 20 years. That means hundreds of billions of richly annotated sentences that are waiting to be used for innovative ML projects. If you are excited by the opportunity to work with a world class technical team to deliver game changing ML products then we want to talk to you.


About the project:
You’ll be a part of an innovative financial search application using the latest technologies in machine learning to improve diversification, personalization, and many others. We are working with the latest technologies in Transformers and Deep Learning for text. Also, you will be part of designing new POCs that become ML solutions for the company.


About the team:
The ML team at Ravenpack is a group of 3 talented remote engineers that work passionately with Natural Language Processing and the latest advances in Deep Learning. As full stack ML Engineers, we are in charge of defining the entire cycle from data cleaning to model training finishing with the deployment and building of the MLOPs pipeline.


First month
The onboarding process starts... You will be having scheduled meetings with the main stakeholders of the different teams in order to get an overall understanding of all company products and specifically focus on the projects you will be working on. You will start participating in the scrum ceremonies and also you will work on a project from scratch with the support of the ML team.


After 3 months
Now you have a plan on how to solve the project. You will train your models and you will deploy them to test in the development stage. You will participate in code reviews, testing, and documentation. You will communicate progress and results with stakeholders and other members of the team.


6 months in
Now, you have likely gained a significant amount of experience and knowledge in the field. Some tasks and responsibilities you may be expected to perform include:
Actively participating in the research and development of new Machine Learning models.
Continuously optimizing and improving the performance of existing models.
Building and deploying Machine Learning pipelines and models in production environments, and working with other members of the team to integrate them into real-world applications.
Collaborating with other teams and departments, such as Data Science, Software Engineering, and Product Management, to ensure that the Machine Learning models are meeting the needs of the business.
Staying up to date with the latest developments and advances in the field of Machine Learning, and experimenting with new techniques and tools to improve the performance of your models.
Communicating progress and results with stakeholders, including executives and other members of the organization.


Requirements:
BSc/BA in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience.
Programming experience (we mainly work with Python) to obtain, manipulate, and analyze data.
Build, deploy and maintain Machine Learning (we mainly use sklearn) and Deep Learning (we mainly use TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Hugginface) models to solve specific business problems like ranking, classification, or representation learning
Experience building data products from POC to production.
Experience understanding search platforms, how to do efficient queries, ranking results and evaluate the quality of the system.
Capacity for handling uncertainty and balancing priorities in a fast-paced environment.

Desirable
MLOPs pipelines and best practices
Data-centric approach
Data engineering skills

Benefits:
We have a Lab day, basically one day each sprint to investigate whatever field is fascinating to you. You want to try something new or a crazy idea with our data. Do it on this day.
We receive continuous support and training on the latest ML technologies (i.e. MLOPs, Search and ranking, recommendations, and many others)
Each week we have 1 hour to do our Takumi session. The objective of this session is to learn something new from your colleagues. Thanks to this Takumi session we learn new things, for example about graph neural networks and how to use pre-trained models to generate training samples…

What's in it for you
You will work with the latest technologies.
Our Headquarter is located in Marbella. We are offering Hybrid work.
Free Company shuttle bus from Malaga, Fuengirola, la Riviera and Estepona.
You will have ownership of projects working in a collaborative environment where we will value your contribution.
You will work in an agile environment able to react quickly to changes with a fairly flat hierarchy.
As we encourage continuous learning, we will support your ongoing training.
Diversity is in our DNA! You will work in an international environment (over 29 nationalities and 24 languages spoken!)
